manifest_description.message: Toggles comments on many popular websites.

private_chrome_note.message: This option is ignored in incognito tabs.

private_edge_note.message: This option is ignored in InPrivate Mode.

private_firefox_note.message: This option is ignored during Private Browsing.

private_opera_note.message: This option is ignored in Private Mode.

keyboard_shortcut_not_configurable.message: You can also toggle comments by pressing $shortcut$.

review_banner.message: Shut Up has limited website access.

review_header.message: Shut Up has limited website access

review_permissions.message: Comment sections will be blocked automatically, but only on these websites:

review_guidance.message: This extension works best when it can access all websites, but you may continue using Shut Up with reduced permissions.

fix_welcome_message.message: You’re one step away from comment-free browsing.

fix_guidance.message: Shut Up needs access to the websites you visit to function. It only uses this access to hide comment sections.

fix_reassurance.message: Shut Up won’t record or share your browsing history.

fix_lm1.message: This extension adds CSS rules into every website you visit to block comment sections before you can see them. This function requires permission to change the websites you visit.

fix_lm2.message: Shut Up won’t read the contents of the sites you visit, nor will it contact any other services. It can’t track you.

fix_lm3.message: I’m committed to your security and privacy. $privacy_policy_link$ Shut Up is $an_open_source_project$ so anyone can audit its behavior.

privacy_policy_link.content: Read my plain-English privacy policy here.
